topic: Melbourne business rejects Israeli woman over origin

ideas.title: The Lygon Street Lineup
ideas.premise: A woman tries to order a pizza on Lygon Street, but each restaurant asks for her ancestry before serving her, leading to a ridiculously long queue of people proving their Italian heritage.
ideas.why_funny: Exaggerated stereotype of Lygon Street's Italian heritage and Melbourne's multiculturalism clash.

ideas.title: The Bogan Border Check
ideas.premise: An Israeli woman attempts to enter a Bunnings sausage sizzle, but a stereotypical bogan demands she prove she's 'Strayan' enough before getting a snag.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposes a serious issue with the quintessential Aussie experience of a Bunnings sausage sizzle.

ideas.title: The Quantum Quandary
ideas.premise: An Israeli scientist working at Melbourne's Quantum Brilliance tries to explain quantum physics, but keeps getting interrupted by people asking about her origin.
ideas.why_funny: Highlights the absurdity of focusing on someone's origin in a highly intellectual setting.

ideas.title: The Cup Day Catastrophe
ideas.premise: During Melbourne Cup Day, a punter refuses to take betting tips from an Israeli woman, fearing her origin will jinx his chances of winning.
ideas.why_funny: Uses the high-stakes atmosphere of the Melbourne Cup to amplify the ridiculousness of prejudice.

ideas.title: The Power Bank Paranoia
ideas.premise: After the Melbourne Airport power bank incident, a business owner irrationally bans all Israelis from using power banks in his lounge.
ideas.why_funny: Plays on the overreaction to a single event and the absurdity of collective punishment.
